content: The San Pedro River is an unusual northward-flowing stream originating in the Sierra Manzanal Mountains about 10-15 miles south of the U.S./Mexico border south of Sierra Vista, Arizona…”The San Pedro River’s cottonwood-shaded corridor provides critical stopover habitat for millions of migrating birds each year.” (The Nature Conservancy)__no.0467, 2020.  #Southwest #birdmigration #criticalhabitat
